President of Democratic Congo Expresses Solidarity with Korean People's Struggle
articles.content:
President of Democratic Congo Expresses Solidarity with Korean People's Struggle 
    Pyongyang, May 30 (KCNA) -- Joseph Kabila, president of the Democratic Republic of Congo, expressed firm solidarity with the Korean people in theirstruggle for achieving prosperity and progress of the country, rallied close around leader Kim Jong Il, when receiving credentials from the new DPRK ambassador e. p. on May 26.
 He wished the Korean people a greater success in their struggle to achieve peaceful reunification of the country under the banner of national independence and to solve the DPRK-U.S. nuclear issue peacefully through dialogue.    
 The friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries have long developed and democratic Congo will further boost cooperative relations with the DPRK in different fields in the future, too, he added.

articles.title: Ethiopian President Refers to Friendly Relations with DPRK
articles.content:
Ethiopian President Refers to Friendly Relations with DPRK 
    Pyongyang, May 30 (KCNA) -- Girma Woldegiorgis, president of the Federal Democratic Republic of Ethiopia, hoped that the friendly and cooperative relations between Ethiopia and the DPRK would continue to expand and develop in different domains as in the past, when meeting DPRK ambassador O Nam Jung, who paid a farewell call on him on May 26.
 He said he was pleased that the sturdy and diligent Korean people were firmly defending the sovereignty and dignity of the country under the wise guidance of Kim Jong Il.

Work of Kim Jong Il Published in Venezuela
articles.content:
Work of Kim Jong Il Published in Venezuela 
    Pyongyang, May 29 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il's famous work "On Thoroughly Establishing the System of Party Leadership" was published in booklet by the Communist Party of Venezuela Publishing House.
 The work, brought out on April 28, Juche 68 (1979), elaborates on issues arising in firmly ensuring the party's leadership over the revolution and construction including the issue of establishing the revolutionary trait of unconditionally accepting and carrying out decisions and instructions of the Workers' Party of Korea to the letter and the issue of establishing steel-strong revolutionary discipline whereby the whole party acts as one.

DPRK Foreign Minister Congratulates His Indian Counterpart
articles.content:
DPRK Foreign Minister Congratulates His Indian Counterpart
    Pyongyang, May 29 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun sent a congratulatory message to K. Natwar Singh on his appointment as foreign minister of the Republic of India.
 In the message he sincerely wished the new Indian foreign minister happiness, good health and great success in his work, expressing the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries will continue to favorably develop in the future.

articles.title: Relief Goods Donated to DPRK
articles.content:
Relief Goods Donated to DPRK
    Pyongyang, May 29 (KCNA) -- Relief goods were sent to the DPRK by various countries and international organizations in connection with the explosion at Ryongchon Railway Station in North Phyongan Province.
 Emergency relief goods came to the DPRK from China, Russia and Syria at the end of April. In May relief goods including medicines, medical apparatuses and daily necessaries were sent to the DPRK by governments, organizations, institutions, enterprises and individuals of various countries including Laos, Malaysia, Mongolia, Singapore, Cambodia, Thailand, Japan, Greece, Norway, the Netherlands, Denmark, Germany, Hungary, Switzerland, Sweden, the Czech Republic, France, Finland, Poland, Ireland, United Kingdom, Austria, the U.S.A., Canada and Australia. Those things were also donated to the DPRK by international and regional organizations including the UN Office for the Co-Ordination of Humanitarian Affairs, the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent, the World Health Organization, the United Nations Children��s Fund, the World Food Program, the United Nations Population Fund, and the European Union.    
 Various kinds of relief goods came from overseas compatriot's organizations including the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan, organizations and compatriots from all walks of life in different countries and regions.
